FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Dawn Food Products owns and operates a bakery product manufacturing facility located in Mexico, Missouri. On site, Dawn Foods has an ammonia refrigeration system which contains anhydrous ammonia, a regulated hazardous substance, for the refrigeration and freezing of bakery products made at the facility. The maximum intended inventory of ammonia on site is above the threshold quantity listed in 40 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 68.130.

Since the quantity of ammonia exceeds the threshold quantity, Dawn Food Products is required to implement a Risk Management Program (RMP) at the Mexico facility which includes three (3) major elements: hazard assessment, prevention program, and emergency response program. The submission of the RMPlan presents the details of the RMP compliance measures conducted by Dawn Food Products. 

Dawn Food Products is also subject to OSHA's Process Safety Management Program (PSM). Based on the information presented in this report, Dawn Food Products is subject to Program level 3 requirements of the RMP regulation.

1.1  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Dawn Food Products is committed to the protection of the safety, health, and environment in our routine operations and emergency responses. Our prevention and emergency response practices are developed to protect the public as well as our own employees. It is our policy to comply with applicable laws, and to support and work with local emergency response agencies.

1.2  Description of Dawn Food Products and the Regulated Substance Handled
Dawn Food Products operates a bakery products manufacturing facility in Mexico, MO. Dawn Food Products produces fresh bread products which are then frozen and shipped to various facilities nationwide. The ammonia refrigeration system provides the necessary freezing of the product for shipment. In addition, the ammonia refrigerations system is utilized to provide cooling for the plant itself. There is approximat

ely 26, 238 pounds of ammonia located within the closed-loop ammonia refrigeration system.

1.3  General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
Dawn Food Products has specific process controls in place to minimize the risks of spills. Dawn Food Products has a preventive maintenance software program in place to address maintenance of all vital parts of the plant's day to day operations. All inspection and testing procedures are contained within this program and are issued as required to the Dawn Food Products personnel for completion. In addition, there are many safety controls installed within the system. These include an interlock system, alarms, and ammonia detectors located within the ammonia refrigeration system.

1.4  Five Year Accident History
In the past five years, there have been no accidental releases of ammonia as outlined in 68.42 of the RMP Regulations.

1.5  The Emergency Response Program
Dawn Food Products emergency response policies have been designed to comply with all applicable state and federal regulations. These policies summarize the actions to be taken in response to a chemical spill. In the event of a spill, Dawn Food Products will react with the proper actions, as listed in the Emergency Response Plan, in association with the local fire department and City of Mexico, MO Public Safety Department.

1.6  Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Dawn Food Products makes safety a first priority in its every day operations to ensure a safe working environment for all of its employees. Dawn Food Products is committed to continuously improving the facility's safety and working practices through employee involvement and development.
